hours_text:
# The Abbe Museum in Downtown Bar Harbor

**26 Mt Desert Street / PO Box 286 / Bar Harbor, ME 04609**

## **CLOSING FOR THE SEASON ON OCTOBER 31**

  * ###  Hours 

**_CLOSING FOR THE SEASON ON OCTOBER 31ST_. You can visit in the off-season by booking a tour — **[**Learn more here »**](https://abbemuseum.org/programs)

**10 am to 5 pm, Monday through Friday. No admission will be sold after 4:30 pm.**

The Abbe Museum is committed to continuing to improve our accessibility efforts and be inclusive to all who wish to visit. We invest in the training of our front-line staff and our exhibition and programming teams to ensure that our content is accessible to all with as few barriers as possible. If there is anything you may need or have questions about ahead of your visit, please don’t hesitate to reach out to 207-288-3519 or visit@abbemusuem.org. Service dogs are welcome at the Museum. Pets and emotional support animals are not allowed.

  * ###  Admission 

No reservations required for groups of 9 or less.

    * Adults: $18

    * Seniors/Valid College ID: $14

    * Adolescents (5-17): $10

    * Children 4 & under: Free

    * Group rates & tours: [**More Info**](https://www.abbemuseum.org/two-locations#groups)

FREE admission for those with a Tribal ID, Military ID, and Abbe Museum members.

Visitors with cognitive, intellectual, and developmental disabilities receive a $2 discount and free admission for one caretaker.

admission_text:
# Become a Member of the Abbe!

Discover something new on every visit and stay connected year-round. Enjoy unlimited free admission, priority access, member discounts, and more. 

**Join today and become part of our global community of supporters dedicated to helping the Abbe educate and inspire thousands each year.**

[ $75 ](https://app.moonclerk.com/pay/4htkfug3f24g)

[ $125 ](https://app.moonclerk.com/pay/36q6808g87s)

[ Other ](https://app.moonclerk.com/pay/5en7h6zb09cp)

## Member Benefits

All new or renewing members at the **$75 Level** will receive the following member benefits:

  * Free admission for two adults and children under 18 living in the same household.

  * 10% discount on Abbe Shop purchases (excludes online shop)

  * Advance notice of Museum programs, and invitations to member only experiences and events.

Members renewing at the **$125 Level** will receive all of the above including: 

  * Free admission to museums in the [**_North American Reciprocal Museums (NARM)_ program**](https://narmassociation.org/).

  * Free subscription to[ **_First American Art Magazine_**](http://firstamericanartmagazine.com/), published four times a year.

If you have questions about your membership, please contact us at [**(207) 288-3519**](tel:+12072883519) or [**membership@abbemuseum.org**](mailto:membership@abbemuseum.org).

## Why Membership?

For over ninety years the Abbe Museum has changed lives through learning – challenging perspectives and encouraging our visi...
collections_text:
# To illuminate and advance greater understanding of and support for Wabanaki Nations’ heritage, living cultures, and homelands.

In recent years, the Abbe has grown from a small trailside museum, privately operated within Acadia National Park, to an exciting contemporary museum in the heart of downtown Bar Harbor. At the Abbe's downtown museum, visitors find dynamic and stimulating exhibitions and activities interspersed with spaces for quiet reflection. The history and cultures of the Native people in what we now know as Maine, the Wabanaki, are showcased through changing exhibitions, special events, teacher workshops, and workshops for children and adults. 

> “The museum is heartfelt, accessible, and has something for all visitors but doesn’t shy away from telling the hard truths of the past and present. We are all involved in the process of making the world better. Thank you for the opportunity to learn and appreciate, to recognize beauty and work, and the unity of all things.” —Emma, 2018

* * *

## Plan Your Visit

[ ](/two-locations)

The Abbe Museum is open seasonally from May - October. We encourage you to review our hours of operation and admissions rates in advance of your visit. [**Read more >**](/two-locations)

## Book a Tour

[ ](/programs)
